reference.title: Default open ports
reference.shortdesc: The following ports are open by default on the IBM StoredIQ.

section.title: SSH port 22
section.p: By default, port 22 is open on all IBM StoredIQ hosts. The port is used for Secure Shell (SSH) communication and allows remote administration access to the VM. In general, traffic is encrypted using password authentication. To add a layer of security, you can establish key-based authentication for passwordless SSH logins to any of the IBM StoredIQ nodes in your environment as described in “Configuring SSH key-based authentication” on page 45.

section.title: Default open ports on the AppStack
Default open ports on the IBM StoredIQ data server

row.entry: PROD-transport (IBM StoredIQ transport services; communication between the gateway and the data server)

section.title: Enable or disable ports or services on the IBM StoredIQ data server
section.p:
To manage ports, you can use the /usr/local/storediq/bin/util/port_handler.pyc script with the appropriate parameter:
python /usr/local/storediq/bin/util/port_handler.pyc -parameter

section.title: -s
section.p: To list the current rules in iptables

section.title: -d port_number|'port_range'
section.p: To delete a port or a range of port numbers from iptables, for example: python /usr/local/storediq/bin/util/port_handler.pyc -d '21200:21299'

section.title: -e 'service_name'
section.p: To enable a specific service, for example, to enable HTTPS services: python /usr/local/storediq/bin/util/port_handler.pyc -e 'PROD-https'

section.title: -d 'service_name'
section.p: To disable a specific service, for example, to disable HTTPS services: python /usr/local/storediq/bin/util/port_handler.pyc -d 'PROD-https'

section.title: Default open ports on the nodes in the Elasticsearch cluster

row.entry: SimpleHTTPServer (used for copying the siq-elasticsearch. yml configuration file from the Elasticsearch node to the data server)

docker-proxy (listening for REST requests) You can restrict access to this port by either enabling Search Guard or by setting up a firewall. For more information, see “Securing Elasticsearch cluster communication with Search Guard” on page 51 or “Restricting access to port 9200 on Elasticsearch nodes” on page 52.

section.title: Default open ports on the IBM StoredIQ gateway

row.entry: PROD-transport (IBM StoredIQ transport services; communication between the gateway and the data server)

section.title: Supported chain and rules on the IBM StoredIQ gateway
section.p:
In iptables, the following firewall and chain rules are defined:
'PROD-transport':['5434','8765','7766','11102','11103','11104'], 'PROD-https':['443'], 'PROD-ssh':['22'], 'PROD-web':['80'], 'PROD-postgres':[’5432’]
'desktop' service: 'PROD-broker':['21000'], 'PROD-collectionsvc':['21300:21399'] 'PROD-desktopupgrade':['21004'], 'PROD-objlistmgr':['21100:21199'], 'PROD-objlistsvc':['21200:21299'], 'PROD-rgistration':['21001'], 'PROD-session':['21002'], 'PROD-task':['21003'],
